name: Gluten-free Pull Apart Dinner rolls
description: These vegan gluten free dinner rolls make for a great side dish for your main meal.
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup sweet sorghum flour (I useBob's red mill)
1/4 cup + 2 Tablespoons water (if you boil potatoes and have some potato water, use that)

recipeInstructions.text: Warm 2 Tbsp water and add yeast and a teaspoon of sugar, Mix well and let sit until frothy. 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Warm 2 Tbsp water and add yeast and a teaspoon of sugar, Mix well and let sit until frothy. 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile, whisk the flours, salt, starches together.
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile, whisk the flours, salt, starches together.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the flours, rest of the sugar, and oils to the yeast mixture and mix.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the flours, rest of the sugar, and oils to the yeast mixture and mix.

recipeInstructions.text: Add vinegar to 1/4 cup water, and combine well to form a thick batter. Add a few drops of water if it feels dry.
recipeInstructions.name: Add vinegar to 1/4 cup water, and combine well to form a thick batter. Add a few drops of water if it feels dry.

recipeInstructions.text: Keep this batter covered in a warm place until doubled. 1.5 hours.
recipeInstructions.name: Keep this batter covered in a warm place until doubled. 1.5 hours.

recipeInstructions.text: The batter will be doughy and less sticky after the rise. Oil hand and Use a teaspoon or so potato starch to help get the dough together and form balls.(adjust the dough to a soft not too sticky consistency at this point. If too dry, add some sprinkles of water and knead. If too wet, use a bit of potato starch to make it less sticky but not entirely like a dry bread dough)
recipeInstructions.name: The batter will be doughy and less sticky after the rise. Oil hand and Use a teaspoon or so potato starch to help get the dough together and form balls.(adjust the dough to a soft not too sticky consistency at this point. If too dry, add some sprinkles of water and knead. If too wet, use a bit of potato starch to make it less sticky but not entirely like a dry bread dough)

recipeInstructions.text: Place balls in a parchment lined Stoneware container(I used 5 inch ramekin)
recipeInstructions.name: Place balls in a parchment lined Stoneware container(I used 5 inch ramekin)

recipeInstructions.text: Spray top liberally with water and sprinkle seeds of choice.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray top liberally with water and sprinkle seeds of choice.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled.
recipeInstructions.name: Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled.

recipeInstructions.text: Spray top liberally with water and cover the container with foil to seal the steam in. Make a tiny hole on top.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray top liberally with water and cover the container with foil to seal the steam in. Make a tiny hole on top.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 375 degrees F for 20-22 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 375 degrees F for 20-22 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Take foil off and let the rolls sit in the oven for a minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Take foil off and let the rolls sit in the oven for a minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from pan and parchment, cool for a minute and serve with some evoo or vegan butter.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from pan and parchment, cool for a minute and serve with some evoo or vegan butter.

keywords: dinner rolls, gluten free bread, vegan bread
